intro: Skimmia hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan skimmia, is a species of evergreen shrub native to southern China. It belongs to the family Rhizophoraceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, orange-red berries. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical and subtropical forests. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers, which bloom in clusters during the winter months. Skimmia hainanensis is also noted for its slow growth rate and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
